title: Design Agent Profiles — Visual Identity for All 15 Agents
description: Create a visual identity profile for each of the 15 ChAI agents (5 core + 3 design + 3 marketing + 3 sales). Each profile should include: avatar/icon concept, color palette, typography, personality brief, and signature style. After profiles are complete, individual agent email addresses will be created. This is a blocker for agent email independence.

title: Build bridge.mycan.website — Private Team Portal
description: Build an auth-gated internal team portal at bridge.mycan.website. This is NOT public. It should serve as the workspace for all 5 teams (core, design, marketing, sales, legal) to view tasks, post updates, see agent statuses, and access shared documents. Should use the existing chai-command-server.js API as backend. Auth via session token. B&W terminal aesthetic matching ChAI brand.

title: Restyle All PDF Deliverables — Design Team Quality
description: The 6 contract PDFs and architecture PDF need a design team quality pass. Current versions are functional but plain. Restyle with Space Mono/Space Grotesk typography, ChAI brand colors, professional layout with headers, footers, page numbers. All B&W, printable. Labeled for email attachment.

title: Google Partnership Pitch Deck — 5PM Deadline
description: Finalize the Google partnership pitch based on google-pitch-plan.md. Create a polished presentation (HTML5 or PDF) that Sales team (Rook, Riven, Sable) can send. Focus on: CALM (ChAI Agent Labor Market) value prop, Gemini 3 Pro oracle integration, Solana escrow, and why Google should partner. Include demo screenshots, architecture diagram, and clear ask.

title: Architecture Cartoon Series — Agent Characters
description: Create a series of architecture cartoon illustrations featuring the ChAI agent characters. Each cartoon should explain a system concept (escrow flow, oracle verification, agent registration, task lifecycle) using the agents as characters. SVG or PNG format. Fun but technically accurate.

title: Open Source License for GitHub — Contest-Ready
description: Draft an open source license for the ChAI GitHub repository. The license should: allow testing and collaboration, be designed for contest/hackathon submissions, protect core IP and proprietary technology, include contributor agreement requirements. Consult with Codex (Contract Architect) and Sigil (Lead Counsel) on IP protection clauses.

title: Security Breach Protocol for GitHub Forks
description: Design a security breach response protocol specifically for GitHub fork scenarios. What happens when someone forks ChAI and: modifies the escrow program, changes oracle behavior, removes safety checks, or attempts to impersonate the platform. Include detection methods, response procedures, and communication templates.

title: Proprietary Technology IP Framework
description: Complete the proprietary technology IP protection framework for ChAI. Identify all proprietary components (CALM framework, escrow design, oracle verification, agent reputation system), document trade secrets vs. patents vs. copyrights strategy, and create an IP register. Work with Sigil and Codex.

title: BRIC Token Integration — Solana SPL Token
description: Research and design the integration plan for BRIC token on Solana. Define tokenomics, minting authority, distribution schedule, and how BRIC interacts with the escrow program. Should agents be payable in BRIC? How does BRIC relate to the reputation system? Draft a technical specification.

title: Roof Token Research — ETH Bridge Feasibility
description: Research the Roof token on Ethereum and design a cross-chain bridge feasibility study. How would ChAI support both SOL-native and ETH-bridged tokens? What bridging protocols exist? What are the security implications? Produce a technical brief with recommendation.

title: Implement Row-Level Security Across Server
description: Implement per-agent and per-team data scoping in chai-command-server.js. Each agent should only read/write its own conversations, task records, and earnings. Team-scoped middleware should restrict endpoints by team membership. See Vigil's RLS design in compliance-auditor.sol.md for architecture.

title: Opus + Kestrel: Draft New Blockchain Concept
description: Opus (Team Lead) and Kestrel (Scout) to collaborate on a new blockchain concept for ChAI. This should be a novel technical proposal — not just 'another L1' but something that serves the autonomous agent labor market use case uniquely. Draft a whitepaper-grade brief. Sales team to review after.

title: Marketing Launch Plan — Colosseum Hackathon Submission
description: Create a comprehensive marketing launch plan for ChAI's Colosseum Agent Hackathon 2026 submission. Include: social media strategy, announcement copy, demo video script, community engagement plan, post-submission follow-up. Surge (Growth Lead) should own this with support from Ember and Hearth.

title: Test Email System — Verify Agent-to-Founder Communication
description: Test the new /api/email endpoint on the live command server. Send a test email from each team lead (Opus, Rune, Surge, Rook, Sigil) to Diana at ChAIgpt@gmail.com. Verify delivery, check formatting, confirm audit log entries. Report any issues.

title: Community Content — Agent Introduction Blog Posts
description: Write introduction blog posts for each of the 5 teams: Core, Design, Marketing, Sales, Legal. Each post should introduce the team members, explain their role in ChAI, and showcase their personalities from their sol.md manifestos. Ember (Content Strategist) should lead, with each agent contributing their own section.
